Posts.Content: lonnie1 wrote: good afternoon everyone -  I am looking for advice regarding my options post my surgery.  I recently had a cancer tumor removed from my breast as well as a limp-node.  The node tested negative for spread of the cancer as well as the tissue/muscles around the tumor.  The doctors are recommending Chemo and I wanted to confirm if it is required?  Oh.... I am five months from my babies delivery.  Can someone assist me! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: recent breast cancer surgery lonnie1 FitChik

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 10:51PM lonnie1 wrote: I am concerned as I do not want to subject my baby to chemo as I am under significant stress and I believe the chemo will add more stress to me and the baby.  Can I wait post the baby and have radiation or is the Chemo required for my situation.
